text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to advise that the court can order an Inquiry as to Damages (or Assessment of Damages) to quantify the final monetary remedy if the client chooses damages. Section 5, under 'What You Can Claim,' explicitly lists 'Damages (Compensation for losses)' and the description of damages includes: 'Actual losses (lost sales you can prove) / Profits they made from infringement / Reasonable royalty (what you'd charge for license)'. While it doesn't use the exact phrase 'Inquiry as to Damages,' the concept of quantifying final monetary remedy through assessment of actual losses and profits is clearly covered under the 'Damages' remedy listed, which is what a court orders in this context.", "criterion_id": "ed5318c8-5a19-4ea7-8275-294ca2b150f6"}
